                                   I N  S E N A T E

       Introduced  by  Sen. SERRANO -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Tourism,
         Parks and Recreation

       AN ACT to amend the parks, recreation and historic preservation law,  in
         relation  to establishing a resident curator program for the rehabili-
         tation of state park buildings

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 3.09 of the parks, recreation and historic preser-
    2  vation law is amended by  adding  a  new  subdivision  2-h  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    2-H. BE EMPOWERED, IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW AUTHORIZ-
    5  ING THE LEASING OF PROPERTY UNDER ITS JURISDICTION, TO ESTABLISH A RESI-
    6  DENT  CURATOR  PROGRAM. THE TERM "RESIDENT CURATOR" SHALL MEAN A PRIVATE
    7  INDIVIDUAL OR INDIVIDUALS, OR NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION SELECTED BY THE
    8  COMMISSIONER, WHO OR WHICH MEETS ESTABLISHED CRITERIA OF THE  OFFICE  TO
    9  INVEST  PRIVATE  OR  OTHER  NON-STATE BUDGETED FUNDS TO REHABILITATE AND
   10  MAINTAIN AN AT RISK STRUCTURE UNDER THE OFFICE'S JURISDICTION.  FOR  THE
   11  PURPOSES  OF THIS SUBDIVISION, THE TERM "AT RISK STRUCTURE" SHALL MEAN A
   12  HOUSE, BUILDING OR OTHER ROOFED STRUCTURE UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF  THE
   13  OFFICE  THAT  IS  OR  HAS  BECOME  FUNCTIONALLY ISOLATED FROM THE DIRECT
   14  PUBLIC SERVICE MISSION OF THE OFFICE SUCH THAT SUCH STRUCTURE IS  VACANT
   15  AND  AT  RISK  OF UNDERGOING PROGRESSIVE DETERIORATION AND/OR FUNCTIONAL
   16  ABANDONMENT BECAUSE OF FISCAL OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANTIAL DIFFICULTIES.
   17    THE COMMISSIONER SHALL BE AUTHORIZED TO LEASE SUCH AT  RISK  STRUCTURE
   18  TO A RESIDENT CURATOR FOR THE LIFE OF THE RESIDENT CURATOR OR FOR A TERM
   19  OF  UP  TO FORTY YEARS IN EXCHANGE FOR THE RESIDENT CURATOR ASSUMING THE
   20  FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE REHABILITATION AND MAINTENANCE OF  SUCH
   21  AT RISK STRUCTURE, AND TO PROVIDE REASONABLE RIGHTS OF ACCESS, UTILITIES
   22  AND  PARKING FOR THE PURPOSE OF RESIDENTIAL OCCUPANCY OR OTHER USES THAT
   23  ARE DEEMED BY THE COMMISSIONER TO BE APPROPRIATE  TO  TAKE  PLACE  AT  A

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00399-01-1

       S. 2749                             2

    1  STATE  PARK  OR  HISTORIC  SITE. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL CONSULT WITH THE
    2  STATE BOARD FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION, ESTABLISHED PURSUANT  TO  SECTION
    3  11.03 OF THIS TITLE, PRIOR TO ENTERING INTO A RESIDENT CURATOR LEASE FOR
    4  ANY AT RISK STRUCTURE, INCLUDING THOSE ELIGIBLE FOR LISTING ON THE STATE
    5  AND NATIONAL REGISTERS OF HISTORIC PLACES.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ADOPT
    6  A  PLAN  IDENTIFYING  AT RISK STRUCTURES IN THE STATE PARKS AND HISTORIC
    7  SITES, AND SHALL ADOPT RULES AND REGULATIONS TO PROMULGATE THE  RESIDENT
    8  CURATOR  PROGRAM,  WHICH  SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, CRITERIA
    9  FOR IDENTIFYING AT RISK STRUCTURES APPROPRIATE FOR THE PROGRAM  AND  THE
   10  CRITERIA USED TO SELECT RESPONSIBLE RESIDENT CURATORS.
   11    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
